channel.title: Jumping is to low
channel.description: Is it normal if I want to jump on the boxes or pipes I have to press jump and crouch right after jump ?

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
You can increase the jump height with the following commands:

bms_normal_jump_vertical_speed
bms_normal_jump_crouch_vertical_speed

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: fuegerstef
item.description:
intooblivion:

If they wanted to “modernize” the game you’d press jump once and automatically play some stupid mounting/jumping animation and be able to jump on crates twice your height in a single bound. Go back to COD and leave the people with multiple useable fingers alone.

If you were able to read, you had read that I have no problems with crouch jumping. And it is OK for what you described somewhere else (jumping through windows, etc…). In Half Life 1 it was right. You had to crouch jump here and there where it was needed but not to jump onto a small step.

But for jumping up small steps it is hindering the flow slightly and is nothing but an unneeded additional key.

And for your info. I am not a COD fan, I am an old school gamer and a game developer (buy the Rise of the Triad remake from Steam later this year and watch the credits, then you know what I mean and what I develop, kiddie). And from a developer’s point of view additional keys for simple actions are a bad design decision. For additional actions and special jumps it is OK. That way I got among the top UT players, a game which has much, much more advanced movement than any HL game or mod and are ranked number 1 (alongside others) at the fast paced Shootmania beta with it’s stamina movement.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: AlanGarou
item.description:
Madcat1030:

Quick question: Can you personally jump onto a 3-4 foot box by simply standing upright and jumping? Alright, maybe you can. Can you do that and land in a fully upright position? No. Just no.

The jumps I’m talking about aren’t anywhere near that high. They’re two feet at the most, yet Gordon is unable to make them in this game unless he crouches mid-jump. And more to the point, can you cave in a monster’s skull with a crowbar? Because that’s about as connected to what happens in the game as what my jumping abilities have to do with those of our fictional protagonist.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: intooblivion
item.description:
It’s meant to simulate bending your knees and tucking your feet up under you, which you do in real life.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
Quick question: Can you personally jump onto a 3-4 foot box by simply standing upright and jumping? Alright, maybe you can. Can you do that and land in a fully upright position? No. Just no.

Crouch-jumping is meant to simulate the fact that you can’t just jump and land upright on something just because your feet cleared it. At least, that’s how I’ve always interpreted it.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: intooblivion
item.description:
If they wanted to “modernize” the game you’d press jump once and automatically play some stupid mounting/jumping animation and be able to jump on crates twice your height in a single bound. Go back to COD and leave the people with multiple useable fingers alone.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: fuegerstef
item.description:
outlive:

…we think it adds to the game

Yes.

Now please add two keys for walking. One for left and one for right leg. That would add even more.

I don’t have a hard time pressing two keys. But it is unneeded. At least in 90% of all cases. In HL I had to crouch jump here and there, not to walk up some stairs.
I know you wanted to modernize the game to a time where games like Gears of War and Bulletstorm don’t allow jumping at all, but this only adds useless keypressing and breaking the flow a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: DaftMink
item.description:
I couldn’t care less about jump height.

Apparently you noobs never played Counter Striker.
There boxes are so much higher up.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: UnhingedMouse0
item.description:
AlanGarou:

I’d like to second the complaints. I’ve been playing for a few hours now, and the jump is frustratingly useless unless you crouch. I understand that there were some points in the original game where you had to crouch-jump, but it was not constantly required. Users should not be forced to press two keys to get use out of their jump, and with how weak the jump key alone is right now, I have not been able to get any success with it.

The original Half-Life had a useful jump, and a powerful crouch-jump. This mod has a useless jump and a passable crouch-jump. Please fix this feature.

This.

AlanGarou:

It’s less that it’s hard and more that it feels like an extra key press being required for no good reason. Why can’t both the jump and crouch-jump be stronger?

This.

AlanGarou:

It’s way weaker than it is in other Source games. I can jump better in HL2 and both of its episodes, and in other Source games like E.Y.E.

This.

Frogacuda:

No one has a problem with the crouch jumping feature, however making it almost impossible to do any jumping puzzles without it is not a “feature”, it’s a poor design choice. You’ve effectively eliminated the jump mechanic as a useful feature, and instead chose a more difficult “advanced” mechanic to use at all times. You took something that needed one button press and made it need two for no real gain.

Furthermore, there is inadequate player training on how to use this mechanic.

This.

…basically, it sucks balls. While most everything else has been awesome, this has frustrated me in EVERY SINGLE CHAPTER. I don’t care what the reasoning behind it is, if it’s a bad game mechanic, it’s a bad game mechanic. Simple as that.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: piter
item.description:
A small hint - bind jump to right mouse button - your life will get better (especially in online fpses).

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I had to press 3 buttons to get to some places. Shift, Ctrl and then Space.

I like it.

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: piter
item.description:
I think it’s ok. In HL2 you had to crouch to get on barrels and same applies here.

It would also be hard to change now, when levels are all designed - this could allow you to get into places, where you wouldnt be allowed otherwise.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: tonkat
item.description:
Frogacuda:

No one has a problem with the crouch jumping feature, however making it almost impossible to do any jumping puzzles without it is not a “feature”, it’s a poor design choice. You’ve effectively eliminated the jump mechanic as a useful feature, and instead chose a more difficult “advanced” mechanic to use at all times. You took something that needed one button press and made it need two for no real gain.

Furthermore, there is inadequate player training on how to use this mechanic.

go play half life. there’s your training.

You’ve effectively eliminated the jump mechanic as a useful feature, and instead chose a more difficult “advanced” mechanic to use at all times. item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: Paz_Ortega_Andrade
item.description:
AlanGarou:

Gordon hasn’t had problems like this in the other games. And I’m pretty sure realism went out the window when the aliens started showing up.

Perhaps, a part of realism went out, but not everything. Otherwise, we would have got a main character breathing fire and officers of security dancing with fish, or something crazy like that

What really was sad for me personally is that in some areas it’s impossible for your friends to follow you, and you’re forced to leave them to their imminent death

It would be better if they were able to overcome at least some obstacles in a way…

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: outlive
item.description:
crouch jumping of nearly every half-life and source game in general, we think it adds to the game

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: AlanGarou
item.description:
Paz Ortega Andrade:

Pressing two keys is not that hard, you know?
It’s more realistic this way, I think. For example, I can’t jump on a crate like that in real life - I’d be forced to somehow climb on it anyway, and I’m in a good shape myself

Plus, we are playing as a scientist. One that is good with weapons, but still, a scientist.

Gordon hasn’t had problems like this in the other games. And I’m pretty sure realism went out the window when the aliens started showing up.

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping is to low
item.dc:creator: AlanGarou
item.description:
Bloodshot:

Am I the only one who did not notice this? It’s not that hard to duck jump.

It’s less that it’s hard and more that it feels like an extra key press being required for no good reason. Why can’t both the jump and crouch-jump be stronger?
